message.content:
cs.DS, cs.IT, cs.CC, cs.CR, cs.LG. 

The paper discusses lattice-based cryptography and algorithms for solving the shortest vector problem (SVP) and closest vector problem (CVP). This falls under the category of theoretical computer science and could be classified under several sub-categories. 

cs.DS (Data Structures and Algorithms) is a likely category as the paper discusses various algorithms for solving SVP and CVP. 

cs.IT (Information Theory) is also a possible category as lattice-based cryptography is a topic in information theory. 

cs.CC (Computational Complexity) is another possible category as the paper discusses the time complexity of SVP and CVP algorithms. 

cs.CR (Cryptography and Security) is a relevant category as the paper discusses lattice-based cryptography and its security. 

cs.LG (Machine Learning) is a less likely category, but still possible as lattice-based cryptography has been used in some machine learning applications.
